Title: NBD Tools: Buffer overflow in NBD server
Synopsis:
The NBD server is vulnerable to a buffer overflow that may result in the
    execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: The NBD Tools are the Network Block Device utilities allowing one to use remote block devices over a TCP/IP network. It includes a userland NBD server.

Description.Text: Kurt Fitzner discovered that the NBD server allocates a request buffer that fails to take into account the size of the reply header.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could send a malicious request that can result in the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the NBD server.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All NBD Tools users should upgrade to the latest version:
